caption:
I met Jean Biermans randomly out on the road in Cape Town a few years ago, he is very well known Dutch rider and has multiple wins at the 36ONE MTB Challenge.

36ONE MTB Challenge is a 361 Km endurance race. Jean not only has won but also set the course record of  14 hours 03 minutes 57 seconds.

But for me the impressive part of this story is how Jean had to fight back after a terrible accident.

in 1991 when Jean, was hit by a bus and dragged for more than 15 meters – leaving the lower part of his left leg torn off, resulting in a very close call to amputate his leg.
It took the doctors three operations in which they eventually managed to repair his leg. This was no easy task because every muscle and tendon around his knee was ripped off completely and the skin and most of the muscles were gone. The surgeons took skin from his upper legs on both sides to reconstruct new skin over his lower leg.

It took two years of practice and physical therapy before he was able to walk without crutches. Some of us can relate to this story of tragedy and courage but all us can be inspired by people like Jean that never say die.

In the last words Jean wrote me today in a mail : Life can suck... but if you really want... success is around the corner.

Jean happy cycling mate, we look forward to see what you get up to next.
